Sentence: That same morning, on the other side of Kansas, Perry Smith meets up with Dick Hickock
Meanwhile, Perry and Dick have returned to Dick's hometown of Olathe
While the investigation in Kansas begins to methodically follow up dead end leads, Perry and Dick spend some time entertaining a rich German tourist before they run out of money in Mexico City
Meanwhile, Dick and Perry are hitchhiking in the American desert
Before they are caught, Dick and Perry steal a car, return to Kansas City, pass more hot checks, and take up residence in Miami
Dick confesses after intense questioning, and Perry follows suit
During a five-year appeals process, Dick and Perry languish in Death Row
Perry tries to starve himself while Dick writes letters to various appeals organization
When death comes, Dick is awkward and Perry is remorseful
